Posts.Content: anna33 wrote:    Greetings!...I was recently diagnosed as Mucinous Adenocarcinoma of the Breast with lymph node involvement stage 3A,rare & invasive but good thing coz the prognosis is better than the other type of invasive breast cancer..April 14, 2008 was the day of my mastectomy and diagnosis and that time I am a Survivor...This coming May 11, 2008 is the day where i can recieve my 1st cycle chemotherapy..    I am only 33 years of age, single and happy but im more happier when i got bc becaused i found myself closer to our Savior Jesus Christ..I gained more friends who love me and keep praying for my speedy recovery,my family as well keep supporting me emotionally and given me thier unconditional love..Never came into my mind to ask Why me of all the people???...I felt a little devastated but no regrets of my decision to undergo an MRM which really save mylife and away from a life threatening condition...   Its a new quite of journey and struggle to have a sudden and untimely disease of having Breast Cancer but trusting God's providence i have to command His will despite the pain and difficulties... Im still young, and so loved and admired not only by my family but all my friends as well..I have to stand being positive and never lose my hope to fight the battle of cancer, in the midst of battle i want to become a Shining Star, a Warrior and an Inspiration to others fighting the same battle..I lost my breast but never lost my brave fighting heart...God is good of all the time..  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: recently diagnose...(April 14, 2008) anna33 bcs75

Posts.Content: May 2, 2008 11:37AM anna33 wrote: Hi sue, be strong and pray hard..believe in the name of Jesus..you will be healed...One is a survivor from the day of diagnosis - You are a survivor!..
